metadata.title: CVE-2023-21980 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Client programs). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.41 and priorand 8.0.32 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows lowprivileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols tocompromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks require human interaction froma person other than the attacker. Successful attacks of this vulnerabilitycan result in takeover of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 7.1(Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:L/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
mariadb-10.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
